title: Nico Tayao
text:
Welcome to the website!
Welcome! I am a Political Science major with a passion for comparative politics from my background as well my time in John Cabot University. Throughout my university career I have focused on Democratic Theory, the connection between Religion and Politics, Security Studies, as well as Middle Eastern Political Dynamics. I have also traveled to Volda, Norway in a direct exchange program between my home university as well as Volda University College where I spent half of 2022 studying the European Union. Between the two institutions in my university years, I have also been involved with research projects undertaken with the university academe, one of which include a pioneering study on Peace and Secrecy.
I am also a Professional Photographer specializing in events and landscapes, registered drone pilot, and I am also very comfortable with Adobe applications such as Lightroom, Photoshop, and even more advanced Color Grading platforms such as DaVinci Resolve.
You can also check out my CV.

title: Projects
text:
Peace and Secrecy Research Study


Link to the Study


In a pioneering research project co-funded by the Norwegian Foreign Ministry entitled “Inclusivity and secrecy: Governing information flows when negotiating peace in complex conflict contexts”, I was involved in a team that gathered literature concerning the Oslo Process, Security Studies concerns in the Middle East, as well as how the confidentiality practices has evolved over time. In a program hosted by John Cabot University in collaboration with the research lead in the European Union Institute as well as experts in Norway, I was a contributor to the study in for a contracted semester.
You can also check out my contributions here


Literature Contributions
